Hello,
I have a couple questions about how heritrix works.

1)
Does recovey=
 from recover.gz work exactly the same as checkpointing?
Im mean, were they=
 created for the same purpose?
The reason Im asking this is that Im able to=
 recover from recover.gz
after the crawl has finished whereas if I do it by=
 checkpointing
(right before crawl finishes), I wouldnt have anything to cr=
awl
afterwards, unless I introduce new seeds to it. So, I create jobs
based=
 on a recovery everyday, and as the domain Im crawling has been
updated on =
a daily basis, I always have something to crawl, even not
introducing new s=
eeds to it.

2)
Im getting some -5000 status code during a crawl and, acord=
ing to the
user manual, this would only happen if scope was changed during =
a
crawl. I get -5000 only at documents that match a specific word on a
URIR=
egExpFilter I've created for an override. Also, these documents
that get -5=
000 do not have parent URIs...aparently, the're somehow
assembled in a scri=
pt(js). Are you aware of situations that might
trigger this error? 

Thanks=
,

Sam
